title: 武漢肺炎｜《泰晤士報》：日本政府認定東京奧運將要取消 爭取2032年主辦權

replies.msg:
https://hk.appledaily.com/international/20210122/XPF6ROCAZBHVDCSCFER3HZCY2I/

武漢肺炎｜《泰晤士報》：日本政府認定東京奧運將要取消 爭取2032年主辦權
28分鐘前

英國《泰晤士報》引述日本執政聯盟高層報道，日本政府私下認定因武漢肺炎疫情持續，今年的東京奧運將要取消，目前的工作是要確保東京可在下一個可行檔期取得奧運主辦權。

路透社

大家放心，武肺完左之後，班㗎狗就會當咩事都冇發生過，d舖一樣開藥房俾班支那，係咁奶係咁奶，唔會去諗邊個令到冇左奧運，邊個令到日本爆到開花，之後更加唔會諗點樣係經濟方面去支那化，後生繼續玩抖音，繼續扮天下太平。

朝日新聞同日報道，東京都醫師會長尾崎治夫月中接受專訪時表示，確診人數居高不下，東京都內的醫療體系緊迫，鑑於目前的狀況，政府和奧委會應該提出切合實際的對策才行，包括應開始研議是否採用無觀眾（閉門賽）方式舉辦。

巴赫接受共同社採訪時稱，即使日本首都和其他地區的感染人數急劇增加，可能令大家對東京奧運心生疑慮，但他表明奧委會「沒有替代方案」。

巴赫在訪問中表示，國際奧委會對保障參與奧運的人士安全持靈活態度，暗示不排除限制觀眾人數，他認為各方會視乎3及4月的抗疫和疫苗供應進度，再考慮7月奧運的觀眾入場措施。

replies.msg: 2024 Paris 順延姐係要等多7年，法國佬彩你都on9

Veteran International Olympic Committee member Dick Pound on Wednesday reaffirmed his belief the Tokyo Games will happen this summer despite the ongoing coronavirus pandemic, saying the Olympics can go ahead without fans in attendance.

“The question is, is this a ‘must-have’ or ‘nice-to-have,'” Pound told Kyodo News. “It’s nice to have spectators. But it’s not a must-have.


“Nobody can guarantee (that the Olympics will go ahead as planned). But I think there’s a very, very, good chance that they can, and that they will,” he said.

According to Pound, a former swimmer who has been an IOC member since 1978, there are six or seven scenarios under consideration concerning spectators, with one being that only Japanese residents will be permitted to attend events.

“It’s certainly one option…In the end, the decision will be based on risk. And the bottom line, they say, is that it’s better to have the games, even if there are no spectators, than it would be to cancel them because there are no spectators,” the 78-year-old Pound said.

In a telephone interview in July, the Canadian said that shutting out international spectators would run counter to the Olympics’ cosmopolitan spirit, and it was not on the cards at the time.

In March last year, Pound predicted the Tokyo Olympic and Paralympic Games will be postponed because of the coronavirus before the decision to push the games to 2021 was announced by the IOC and the organizing committee.

Dick Pound | REUTERS
Dick Pound | REUTERS
Despite mounting public pressure for a cancellation amid a dramatic spike in coronavirus cases worldwide, the IOC and organizers have already said another postponement is impossible, leaving either cancellation or opening the games on July 23 as the only options.

“I think the IOC and the organizers are committed to going ahead with the games, if at all possible. And so they’re not going to cancel unless there’s a consensus among the government, health authorities and the IOC that it would be too dangerous,” Pound said Wednesday.

“But at the moment, the plans are in place. All the indications are that we should go ahead. There’s no reason why the games can’t go on.”
